page.title: 06What's found in Kylestrome?
page.content: All of this area is rich in wild life. Common Seals and Grey Seals can be seen in the lochs, while otters, badgers and foxes are fairly common sights too. Red deer are down in the area especially during cold weather. Being in such a remote area, wild flowers, ranging from the common to the very rare, can grow un_hindered. Bog bean, Lesser Spearwort, Water Lobelia and Monkey_Flowers can be found in and around the lochs. Among the rocks, along the shore, Sea Pink, Sea Campion, Scurvygrass and Good King Henry can be seen. Many varieties of heathers cover the hillsides. There wild orchids, Tufted Vetch and Milkwort are also growing. Golden Saxifrage, Round leaved Sundew, which feed on the midges, and the Lesser Butterfly Orchid are found in bogs. These are some of our wild flowers.
